snippet: As demand rises again, the big question is whether it will be sufficient to keep all of Europe’s steels mills running.
abstract: European steel mills are firing up again following spate of dismal years, as industry experts predict revival in the hard-hit sector; trend could mean soaring profits for industry giant ArcelorMittal and its rivals, but questions remain about whether demand will be sufficient to keep all European mills busy.

byline.original: By STANLEY REED and PALKO KARASZ
byline.contributor: Stanley Reed reported from Dunkirk, France, and Palko Karasz from London.

lead_paragraph: As demand rises again, the big question is whether it will be sufficient to keep all of Europe’s steels mills running.

headline.main: Warily, Europe’s Steel Makers Are Firing Up Their Furnaces Again
headline.print_headline: Warily, Europe’s Steel Makers Are Firing Up Their Furnaces Again
